articles.headline: Should Gay Couples Worry About Their Benefits Under Trump?
articles.snippet: Readers had concerns about whether same-sex married couples and their protections would face new risks during a second Trump term.
articles.abstract: Readers had concerns about whether same-sex married couples and their protections would face new risks during a second Trump term.
articles.lead_paragraph: For nearly a decade, same-sex married couples have received the same federal rights and protections that their straight counterparts enjoy. They include a long list of financial benefits, from spousal health coverage to less expensive tax preparation, not to mention the immeasurable comfort from knowing their unions must be recognized.

articles.headline: Matt Gaetz Withdraws From Consideration for Attorney General
articles.snippet: Mr. Gaetz has consistently denied the allegations of sexual misconduct and drug use, but his prospective nomination ran into trouble in the Senate.
articles.abstract: Mr. Gaetz has consistently denied the allegations of sexual misconduct and drug use, but his prospective nomination ran into trouble in the Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Matt Gaetz, who faced a torrent of scrutiny over allegations of sex trafficking and drug use, abruptly withdrew his bid to become attorney general on Thursday in the first major political setback for President-elect Donald J. Trump since his election this month.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Swan

articles.headline: The Metamorphosis of Pete Hegseth: From Critic of War Crimes to Defender of the Accused
articles.snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick to lead the Defense Department was described by peers as a skillful soldier who became embittered by military dysfunction.
articles.abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick to lead the Defense Department was described by peers as a skillful soldier who became embittered by military dysfunction.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Pete Hegseth was an earnest, young Army lieutenant in Iraq in 2005, he was cleareyed on how he viewed crimes committed by soldiers in war.
articles.byline: By Dave Philipps and Carol Rosenberg

articles.headline: International Criminal Court Seeks Netanyahu’s Arrest Over Gaza War
articles.snippet: The court accused Benjamin Netanyahu and his former defense minister of having “intentionally and knowingly deprived” Gaza’s population of food, water, fuel and medicine.
articles.abstract: The court accused Benjamin Netanyahu and his former defense minister of having “intentionally and knowingly deprived” Gaza’s population of food, water, fuel and medicine.
articles.lead_paragraph: The International Criminal Court on Thursday issued arrest warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and his former defense minister, Yoav Gallant, accusing them of war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip and dealing an extraordinary blow to Israel’s global standing as it presses on with wars on multiple fronts.
articles.byline: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg, Aaron Boxerman, Steven Erlanger and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: Inside the Deadliest Job in America
articles.snippet: Logging has long been a way of life for rural communities in the Pacific Northwest and South. It also comes with grave risk.
articles.abstract: Logging has long been a way of life for rural communities in the Pacific Northwest and South. It also comes with grave risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mostly employed in densely forested pockets of the Pacific Northwest and the South, loggers have the highest rate of fatal on-the-job injuries of any civilian occupation in the nation, outpacing roofers, hunters and underground mining machine operators.
articles.byline: By Kurtis Lee and Kristina Barker

articles.headline: Why Trump Allies Say Immigration Hurts American Workers
articles.snippet: JD Vance and others on the “new right” say limiting immigration will raise wages and give jobs to sidelined Americans. Many studies suggest otherwise.
articles.abstract: JD Vance and others on the “new right” say limiting immigration will raise wages and give jobs to sidelined Americans. Many studies suggest otherwise.
articles.lead_paragraph: As President-elect Donald J. Trump’s second administration takes shape, his plans for a signature campaign promise are becoming clear: mass deportations of undocumented immigrants, including new detention centers, workplace raids and possibly the mobilization of the military to aid in expulsions.

articles.headline: As Ukraine Fires U.S. Missiles, Putin Sends a Chilling Message
articles.snippet: The Russian leader ominously declares that America risks nuclear war as it expands its aid.
articles.abstract: The Russian leader ominously declares that America risks nuclear war as it expands its aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: In many ways, President Vladimir V. Putin seems to be winning.

articles.headline: Frozen Out: Yelloh, Formerly Schwan’s Home Delivery, Closes
articles.snippet: The frozen food delivery company, known for its yellow trucks, has closed after losing ground to its competitors and renaming itself Yelloh.
articles.abstract: The frozen food delivery company, known for its yellow trucks, has closed after losing ground to its competitors and renaming itself Yelloh.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yelloh, the frozen food delivery service formerly called Schwan’s Home Delivery, which had once been known for its reach with rural Americans and its direct-to-consumer business model, is closing its doors on Friday after decades of decline.

articles.headline: What Elon Musk Needs From China
articles.snippet: From electric cars to solar panels, Mr. Musk has built businesses in high-tech manufacturing sectors now targeted by Beijing for Chinese dominance.
articles.abstract: From electric cars to solar panels, Mr. Musk has built businesses in high-tech manufacturing sectors now targeted by Beijing for Chinese dominance.
articles.lead_paragraph: No American business leader has more visibly and lavishly supported President-elect Donald J. Trump than Elon Musk — and few if any have a more complex relationship with China, a country that Mr. Trump has vowed to confront with higher tariffs and other measures.
